name: 材料光學
goals: To understand the classical theory of light propagation in solid state materials.
To understand the quantum theory of absorption and emission in solids.
To discuss next generation of optical materials, devices and systems application development and trends
syllabus:
【Teaching method: 16+2 weeks】

  

Week1-2      Introduction, the complex refractive index

Week3-5      Lorentz oscillators, dispersion, birefringence

Week6-7      Interband absorption, excitons

Week8         Midterm Exam

Week9-10     Luminescence

Week11-12   Quantum confined structures

Week13-14   Metals, doped semiconductors

Week15        Prospective application development and trend of low-dimensional near-field optical materials, components and systems

Week16        Final Exam

Week17-18   Self-learning

methodologies.note: Introduce important concepts and theories of materials optics. From the classical material optics theory that establishes the student's foundation, guide students to learn the miniaturized quantum material optics theory by themselves, as well as the application technology and knowledge of next-generation optical materials, components and systems, and strengthen their thinking about future application fields.
Open class discussions increase student interaction, communication, and student learning benefits.
Provide exercises and homework for students to practice after class, make use of classroom teaching content, and solve problems.

grading.note: Students write homework assignments, and the students' submission and scores will be used to evaluate the assignments.
